Gains Curve from Performance Data

Source: R/gains.R
plot_gains_curve.Rd

Plot a Gains Curve

plot_gains_curve(
  performance_data,
  chosen_threshold = NA,
  interactive = F,
  main_slider = "threshold",
  col_values = c("#5BC0BE", "#FC8D62", "#8DA0CB", "#E78AC3", "#A4243B")
)

Arguments

performance_data

an rtichoke Performance Data
chosen_threshold

a chosen threshold to display (for non-interactive)
interactive

whether the plot should be interactive plots
main_slider

what is the main slider - threshold, percent positives or positives
col_values

color palette

Examples


one_pop_one_model_as_a_vector %>%
  plot_gains_curve()
#> Error: Problem with `filter()` input `..1`.
#> ℹ Input `..1` is `ppcr == 1`.
#> ✖ Input `..1` must be of size 101 or 1, not size 0.

one_pop_one_model_as_a_vector_enforced_percentiles_symmetry %>%
  plot_gains_curve()
#> Error: Problem with `filter()` input `..1`.
#> ℹ Input `..1` is `ppcr == 1`.
#> ✖ Input `..1` must be of size 101 or 1, not size 0.

one_pop_one_model_as_a_list %>%
  plot_gains_curve()
#> Error: Problem with `filter()` input `..1`.
#> ℹ Input `..1` is `ppcr == 1`.
#> ✖ Input `..1` must be of size 101 or 1, not size 0.

one_pop_one_model_as_a_list_enforced_percentiles_symmetry %>%
  plot_gains_curve()
#> Error: Problem with `filter()` input `..1`.
#> ℹ Input `..1` is `ppcr == 1`.
#> ✖ Input `..1` must be of size 101 or 1, not size 0.

one_pop_three_models %>%
  plot_gains_curve()
#> Error: Problem with `filter()` input `..1`.
#> ℹ Input `..1` is `ppcr == 1`.
#> ✖ Input `..1` must be of size 303 or 1, not size 0.

one_pop_three_models_enforced_percentiles_symmetry %>%
  plot_gains_curve()
#> Error: Problem with `filter()` input `..1`.
#> ℹ Input `..1` is `ppcr == 1`.
#> ✖ Input `..1` must be of size 303 or 1, not size 0.

train_and_test_sets %>%
  plot_gains_curve()
#> Error: Problem with `filter()` input `..1`.
#> ℹ Input `..1` is `ppcr == 1`.
#> ✖ Input `..1` must be of size 202 or 1, not size 0.

train_and_test_sets_enforced_percentiles_symmetry %>%
  plot_gains_curve()
#> Error: Problem with `filter()` input `..1`.
#> ℹ Input `..1` is `ppcr == 1`.
#> ✖ Input `..1` must be of size 202 or 1, not size 0.
if (FALSE) {

one_pop_one_model_as_a_vector %>%
  plot_gains_curve(interactive = TRUE)

one_pop_one_model_as_a_vector_enforced_percentiles_symmetry %>%
  plot_gains_curve(interactive = TRUE, main_slider = "predicted_positives_percent")

one_pop_one_model_as_a_list %>%
  plot_gains_curve(interactive = TRUE)

one_pop_one_model_as_a_list_enforced_percentiles_symmetry %>%
  plot_gains_curve(interactive = TRUE, main_slider = "predicted_positives_percent")

one_pop_three_models %>%
  plot_gains_curve(interactive = TRUE)

one_pop_three_models_enforced_percentiles_symmetry %>%
  plot_gains_curve(interactive = TRUE, main_slider = "predicted_positives_percent")

train_and_test_sets %>%
  plot_gains_curve(interactive = TRUE)

train_and_test_sets_enforced_percentiles_symmetry %>%
  plot_gains_curve(interactive = TRUE, main_slider = "predicted_positives_percent")
}
